page.title: 01Description of the D-Block
page.content: The area is a mixture of{semi-urban, {rural}and{coastal.}The west and the south-west coast consist mainly of {residential estates.}Peripheral to these residential areas and the town of St.Helier are the{Rue des Pres {Industrial Estate}and{recreation areas such as F.B. Fields and St.Clement's Golf Course. Other main{residential {areas}lie along the coast where house prices rise considerably. In addition the Island Development Commitee have allowed the development of{small {housing estates}in the predominantly {rural central and northern areas. The{rural}scene is one of gentle hillsides with{wooded valleys}and {small hedged fields}often above road level, intensively cultivated for such cash crops as potatoes and courgettes, or utilised as pasture for Jersey cattle.
